results.byline: By A.O. Scott and Manohla Dargis
results.abstract: We streamed, we watched, we worried. We also wondered what the catastrophe called 2020 will mean for movies.
results.title: This Year Was a Disaster. We Hope the Sequel Is Better.

multimedia.copyright: Carter Johnston for The New York Times
multimedia.caption: People will want to go back to movie theaters when they can, our critics write, but some of the shifts brought about by the pandemic seem lasting.

results.abstract: An assessment of the actor’s late-career B-movie filmography, including his most recent entry, “Breach.”
results.title: The Bruce Willis Journey From In Demand to On Demand

results.abstract: Helena Zengel is a giggly, chatty 12-year-old, whose movie roles take her into psychological territory that even adults would find tough.
results.title: She’s Starring Opposite Tom Hanks. She’d Never Heard of Him.

results.abstract: Vanessa Kirby gives an intensely physical performance as a woman whose life and marriage are upended by the death of a child.
results.title: ‘Pieces of a Woman’ Review: A Raw, Ragged Study of a Loss

results.abstract: “Ma Rainey’s Black Bottom,” “Sylvie’s Love” and “Soul” understand the music and its place in African-American life, a welcome break with Hollywood history.
results.title: Jazz Onscreen, Depicted by Black Filmmakers at Last

results.abstract: She remained steadfast in her decades-long fight for justice, but her costumes ranged from a golden-eagle emblem and skirt to a W logo breastplate and leggings.
results.title: Wonder Woman and Her Evolving Look

results.abstract: The co-hosts of Slate’s long-running and influential podcast discuss the “urgency” of art in a crisis and whether Meryl Streep should play Anthony Fauci.
results.title: Reviewing a Wild Year in Art With the ‘Culture Gabfest’

results.title: For His Second Act, Nnamdi Asomugha Made Preparation His Byword
results.abstract: The former pro football player has pushed himself in acting classes, onstage and in films. His latest drama, “Sylvie’s Love,” also meant returning to an early passion: music.

results.title: A History of the Cheetah in ‘Wonder Woman’
results.abstract: This villain, played by Kristen Wiig in “Wonder Woman 1984,” has had a long, complicated relationship with her rival.

multimedia.caption: The Cheetah was first introduced in 1943, underwent a revision 44 years later and returned again in 2016.

results.title: Joe Clark, Tough Principal at New Jersey High School, Dies at 82
results.abstract: Bullhorn in hand, he roamed the hallways as he imposed discipline, expelling “miscreants” and restoring order. Morgan Freeman portrayed him in the film “Lean on Me.”

multimedia.caption: Joe Clark in 1988 in a hallway of Eastside High School in Paterson, N.J., where he gained renown for his tough-love approach as the principal.

results.title: Managing Movie Superheroes Is About to Get a Lot More Complicated
results.abstract: Walter Hamada, who runs DC Films, is overseeing a dizzying number of projects, part of a swarm of comics-based stories coming from Hollywood.

results.title: A ‘Great Cultural Depression’ Looms for Legions of Unemployed Performers
results.abstract: With theaters and concert halls shuttered, unemployment in the arts has cut deeper than in restaurants and other hard-hit industries.

results.title: How Pixar’s ‘Soul’ Animates Jazz
results.abstract: A look at the ways filmmakers and musicians collaborated to present an accurate view of players’ artistry.

An Oscar Winner Made a Khashoggi Documentary. Streaming Services Didn’t Want It.
results.abstract: Bryan Fogel’s examination of the killing of the Saudi dissident Jamal Khashoggi had trouble finding a home among the companies that can be premier platforms for documentary films.

results.title: ‘Dear Comrades!’ Review: When the Party Line Becomes a Tightrope
results.abstract: With a bureaucrat as the central character, the film at times takes on a bleakly comic tone as it fills in the circumstances surrounding a massacre.

results.title: A New Pinocchio Film Returns to the Tale’s Dark Origins
results.abstract: The Italian director Matteo Garrone hopes to surprise audiences this Christmas with a very literal retelling of the children’s classic.
